ROYALTY GAS METERING SYSTEM File 075.12 Dear Sir, ^ Several changes have recently been made in the Royalty Gas Metering System as follows The Royalty Gas Meter R-2 measuring 50/ Fuel Gas from the Cracker Drip Tank became very inaccurate and was removed from service. The meter, an old Foxborough, was found to be mechanically unsound and requiring extensive repair work. In view of this and the importance of the meter in computations of the Royalty Gas balance a Taylor instrument has been installed in its place. The orifice installation remains unchanged but the Taylor chart is a 0-10 Square Root which alters the meter factor from 11,000 to 110,000. A new data sheet is attached showing these changes. On meter R-37 measuring Field Gas Flow to the Cracker Drip Tank, the normal flow of gas when there is full gas production in Refinery Operating Plants, is very small (approx. 40,000 C.F.H.). On the present meter R-37 flows as high as 40,000 C,F.H # register at a low point on the chart and great difficulty is experienced in try ing to compute accurate production figures. An additional meter (R-37A) has been installed on the same orifice taps as R-37 but with a full scale flow of 155^300 C,F # H. This new meter will be used for Royalty Gas measurements on small flows whilst R^37 will measure the large flows of field gas consumption when the Refinery Production drops. A data sheet for R-37A is attached. Royalty Gas meter Rp-28 measuring gas production at the No # 4 Naphtha Stabilizer and Rerun unit has been causing some confusion since the readings are not required for the Royalty Balance, All gas passing through it to the Drip Tank is subsequently measured by R^2. physicalDescription.extent: The documents in the file are arranged in chronological order. There is an index at the end of the file (folios 68-72). The index is arranged chronologically and refers to documents within the file; it gives brief description of the correspondence with a reference number which refers back to that correspondence in the file.
The foliation is written in pencil, in the top right corner. It begins on the cover, on number 1, and carries on until 73, which is the last number given on the back cover of the file.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence between the Political Resident at Bushire, the Adviser to the Government of Bahrain and Bahrain Petroleum Company Limited (BAPCO) representatives on the Royalty Gas Metering System in use to determine the royalties to pay to the Sheikh of Bahrain. There is an index at the end of the file (folios 68-72).
